subject: Call for QS keyboard proposals, with voting in January
msgSnippet: Earlier I suggested a vote to choose a standard for this group for an ASCII representation of QS. This would serve two purposes: (1) it would provide a
messageBody:
Earlier I suggested a vote to choose a standard for this group for an
ASCII representation of QS. This would serve two purposes: (1) it
would provide a standard for QS fonts, and (2) it would provide a
simple format for QS document exchange.

Several proposals have been made already. I've put them in a
spreadsheet and uploaded the file (see link below).

The scope of the proposals is the 40 core QS letters, the 4 alternate
letters, the two letters used for Scottish, Welsh and Irish place
names, and the name dot and two angled brackets. To be complete, each
entry should thus have 49 assignments. Assignments should be 7-bit
ASCII (ie no accented characters). I suggest using only upper and
lower case Roman letters for the 46 QS letters. For those who have
already made entries, please send me any updates you'd like me to make
and I'll edit the spreadsheet.

If you have developed your own key mapping proposal, please send it to
me and I'll add it to the spreadsheet. Let's set the deadline of
December 31, 2007 for entering. Let's vote on the entries during the
month of January, 2008. By the end of January, we should have a
standard!

Thanks.

Ted
